question: Which among the following Mahajanpada was located on the junction of two famous ancient Indian Trade routes â€“ Uttarpatha and Dakshinpatha?
explanation: Uttarapatha and Dakshinapatha were two trade routes of ancient India. Mathura was located at the junction of these two famous trade routes. Shurasena was an ancient Yadava ruler of Mathura after whom the Surasena Kingdom or mahajanpada and the Yadava sept of Surasenas were named.
